subtasks: Counting plant stands in the field.
Evaluating plant vigor.
Checking potential winter survival factors.
Considering variety selection for winter wheat.
Assessing the impact of late planting on plant size and reserves.
Determining yield potential based on plant stand levels.

tasks.task: Weed control strategies for winter annuals.
subtasks: Identifying common winter annual weeds (e.g., winter wheat, Japanese brome, downy brome).
Understanding the differences in herbicide susceptibility among weeds.
Selecting appropriate post-emergence herbicides (e.g., Beyond, Polyflex, Maverick) for winter annual control.
Considering mechanical control methods (cultivation) for winter annuals.
Understanding the optimal nitrogen application rates for winter wheat yield potential.
Evaluating the impact of wet conditions on nitrogen efficiency and application timing.
Considering environmental factors (e.g., vernalization, winter survival) in nitrogen management.
Assessing the need for fungicide applications based on disease pressure (tan spot, scab, stripe rust).
Timing fungicide applications for maximum efficacy (early flower stages).
Evaluating resistance to glyphosate and other herbicides.
Assessing performance of northern versus southern winter wheat varieties in specific environmental conditions.
Planting and managing drill seeding operations (late planting).
Conducting field scouting and stand evaluation.
Mechanical tillage practices for weed control (disking, cultivation).
Harvesting and evaluating wheat quality (protein content, yield).
